reviews.sentence: Simply Fabulous. Booked a trip to Seattle for a long weekend in celebration of our 15 year wedding anniversary. From the time we arrived until the time we left the staff and facilities were better then expected. They surprised us with champagne and a cheese cracker tray to our room with a card signed by each employee congratulating us on our anniversary. Not many places would have done such a thing. The hotel was in an excellent location the food was delicious and the atmosphere from the lobby the room the restaurant and patio bar were inviting and made us feel comfortable. It was a more modern atmosphere but was very warm. We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family and will certainly stay there again should our travels take us back to Seattle.

Excellent Hotel. This was the perfect location 4 blocks from the Pike Marketplace. All of the stores for clothes shopping were right outside our door. Great Restaurant in the hotel. Rooms clean and comfortable. Rooms restaurant hotel staff location.

Seattle downtown. visiting seattle for a short vacation. stayed exclusively downtown. thought I may need a car but did not. thus a extra 32 dollars a night for parking I did not need but I knew that ahead of time clean friendly helpful staff within walking distance of all the downtown attractions restraunts. noise of the air handling system felt like I was sleeping in a wind tunnel. not sure if I was able to truly control the temperature. water charge.

Perfect location super clean friendly staff comfortable bed nice restaurant. This hotel is in the perfect location for downtown Seattle shopping and dining. Four blocks from Pike Place Market and 1 block from Westlake Center shopping. The rooms were large and spotless ours had a water view the shower head and water pressure were amazing the beds were extremely comfortable and the staff were friendly and quick to respond to any request. The WiFi was quick to connect and pretty zippy. The room elevators were supersonic. Already planning a return to this fantastic hotelThe separate elevator to the parking garage is painfully slow and there is only one of them. Odd considering the regular elevator travels at mach speeds. This needs a serious upgrade. The night stands need to have more outlets for charging phones etc. Most newer hotels have night stands designed with multiple built in outlets.

Central location professional staff nice amenities. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here. Rooms felt new and very clean with comfortable beds and great views. The amenities here are very nice love the Starbucks Keurig cups in the room and the bathrobes in the closet. Some hiccups along the way like that they were overboked on the night we checked in and we took a handicap room with 2 queens and then moved to a king room the next day. However we loved the professionalism of the front desk staff and their willingness to make us happy and comfortable even transferring our bags between the rooms while we were out sightseeing. And our shower drain ran slow and unfortunately housekeeping staff were not able to fix it despite our request. But that is a small thing compared to the overall experience. We enjoyed being able to walk out the front and head straight down to the market or take a longer walk to Chihuly or other sights. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Great central location clean and friendly. The location is excellent and the staff very friendly and knowledgeable. Appreciated the zippered mattress cover.

Great value and prime location. Excellent location right in the middle of the downtown shopping district. Loved being so close to stores. The monorail was right down the street and we were able to catch it to Seattle Center and the Space Needle. The hotel staff were very courteous and exceeded our expectationsthe only thing I would like the staff to consider is the banning of smoking on all premises. It was sometimes difficult to enter the building without finding someone smoking right where we entered.

Good downtown location nice updates. Clean crisp hotel room with contemporary finishes. Good breakfast at the restaurant. Location is right downtown. We were able to walk to dinner and shopping easily. The front desk staff was friendly and acomodating we forgot our phone charger and he let us plug in for a few minutes to get a charge. Saved our bacon.

Great place to stay. Excellent location in Seattle. We parked our car in the garage when we arrived and never went back to it until we checked out. The hotel staff was very friendly and the room was clean. We definitely will be back.

Nice Hotel with Friendly Staff. The hotel was nice. Enjoyed the water infused with fruit in the lobby. Comfy bathrobes in the room. Had someone available to help with luggage out front. The bathroom was a bit tight the configuration was odd and could only use part of the counter. The unusable portion was due to the commode being placed directly in front of counter within a few inches of the sink. Very awakward. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Ok. Rude check in. Great shower though. A great location. The beds are not as comfortable as they should be. Shower is fantastic. Front desk check. in was very friendly and nice. The checkout was rude. I am sure they know who she is as she was very rude and treated me like I was stupid for asking how to leave the garage as I paid for it with my room. My daughters jaw dropped as she had never heard anyone speak like that to me before. I gave staff a 2 because of the pleasant check in but she would prevent me from going back. I will pay a little more to go somewhere else.

Parking. You have to pay almost fifty bucks for parking but other than that I loved it. They had a pet service that me and my girlfriend were very pleased with. The view of the bay and sunset were to die for.

FIRST TIME TO SEATTLE. Very convenient to space needle and Pike Place. the main things we wanted to see. Hotel is high end with many nice upgrades. Glad we got a good price because there were add ons with parking and service fees. Hotelscom described in details about the hotel about feswe had stay there again.

Great location and great service. My family stayed at Hitel Motif for 2 night after a crude to Alaska. The check in process was really great as they let us check in and get to our room by 10 am after an early disembarkment from our ship. They were so flexible with us. The room was so large and comfortable for two adults and three girls they brought us a rolaway. The rooftop bar and restaurant were lovely and Even though the service as a bit slow the server was delightful and we did not notice the time going by. Upon checkout when I mentioned some loud drunken neighbor not the hotels fault mistakenly trying to enter our room they noted that security was aware of the issue and gave me a substantial credit for the night. Lastly the location was perfect. Short walk to Pikes Place market and the waterfront and one block from the fun monorail that takes you to the Space Needle and lovely park.

Very convenient location and comfortable accommodation in Seattle. Good location and nicely appointed. The Frolik Restaurant Bar is a lively place and there are a number of other food and bar outlets in close proximity. Highly recommended. While the staff were very courteous and tried their best the facilities at check in check out are limited and there are difficulties in handling more than a trickle of clients.

Fun Getaway. We were surprised to find parking convenient under the hotel. At checkin we were upgraded to a water view room. The room was spacious with coffee and water bottles provided. The help at the restaurant and bar were especially friendly and helpful. And the location of the hotel near stores and The Market was perfect. We really enjoyed our overnight stay. We loved the outdoor fire pits. It is a renovated old hotel no doubt. But the decor was very modern and attractive.

We stayed here this past weekend after having booked the hotel online via website recommendations. The booking price was about 200 CDN 150 USD aprox. The actual charged price was 31 CDN about 245USD. After deducting the 35 USd expected parking charge it was still significantly more than expected. Heres what the bill showed. Accommodation 16185 State Sales Tax 307 City Parking Tax 40State Local Tax 1392 Occupancy Tax 13 Seattle Tourism Assessment 20 Amenity Fee 1295 State and Local Tax Fee 11 Occupancy Tax Fe 091Might I suggest that some of these fees and the 195 amenityinternet access charge be incorporated into the basic price of booking. So beware travelers that your actual cost is going to be significantly more than the online booking price. The hotel itself was fine ditto for the customer service from the staff you had get 45 stars if it were not for all the hidden charges.

Stayed here for a night for a business trip enjoyed the beautiful spacious rooms and its close proximity to everything in downtown Seattle. Though a big shoutout goes to the super concierge. Due to a freak storm my cab was delayed by over half an hour. Isayas took initiative to use his personal vehicle to ensure that I and 2 other guests made our flights at Tacoma Airport. Kudos to the great staff and service at this hotel.

Not exactly what I would describe as 5 star service. This is a beautiful property that is well located in the city but I found the service to be lacking. On multiple occasions I tried to call the front desk concierge room service and NOBODY answered the phone. Front desk rang 10 times room service rant 8 to 10 times same with the concierge. This happened more than once. Also cleaning seemed to be a bit lax in the common areas. There were large pieces of purple glitter shaped like male genitalia outside our door on the 15th floor Management If you are reading this I bet if you go up there and look in the hallway near rooms 1507 1510 you will see them. They were there all weekend. The hallways near the elevators were in need of a vacuum. We checked in late in the day and there was a room service tray on the floor in the hallway it was still there the following day at 10 am. Also do not forget this is a hotel with a Amenities Fee. they are going to tack on an additional mandatory 15 a night resort fee to your room. This is a ridiculous practice if the fee is mandatory include it in your nightly rate. Why hide or charge an additional fee if it is mandatory.

Gorgeous hotel in heart of downtown Seattle. The hotel is extremely convenient to Pike Place Market area and a short cab ride to Seattle Science Center area. Staff were extremely courteous and responsive. They used texting as a way to make requests services which I found awesome. However we had extremely rude guests on our floor children screaming through hallway at 20am slamming doors. Tried texting but the service was closed at that time and could not call front desk because others were sleeping in my room. Very poor night sleep. Courteous and responsive staff and location. Pike Place market within walking distance water views quick cab to Space Needle Dave Chihuly Science Center. Noisy neighbors. Maybe texting available at night.

Expensive hotel with extremely frugal customer service. I was charged 50 early check in fee when I check in at 1PM instead of the posted check in time of 4PM. I can understand when hotel or my room type is fully booked or checking in ultra early but charging a fee for checking in 3hr early is not a good way to start an expensive one night stay 300. Expensive rate but cheap services all around. No concierge. No customer service. Only fees after fees. Read the other reviews here yourself nickle and diming its guests seem to be a common theme at Motif. Look elsewhere. You can find better hotels at this price range.
Great hotel. Only negative was service at the restaurant was poor. We sat for several minutes without being served so we left and went elsewhere. Otherwise good.

I have stayed here probably 8 times in the past couple years for work and have had a good experience every time. They recently updated the rooms which is great as this place gets to be a high traffic area in the summer. The rates are great during the winter but more than double in the summer. They have a free drink at the reception desk and the pub below the hotel is accessible by the hotel elevator. The bar has an amazing outside balcony. Beds are comfy the showers have good water pressure it is clean views are amazing and it is located right off the Westlake shopping area so it is accessible to lots of touristy stuff. I wish they had a better reward system for frequent folks that stay and it seems like the last couple times the staff was a bit under trained but they were still friendly.

Too many broken noisy slow and not quite comfortable amenities for the price. This should be a nice hotel but rthe om had noisy air conditioning knocking sounds uncomfortable pillows slow and non protected internet inadequate fitness center maintenance inadequately staffed front desk and poor lighting in the guest rooms.
dirty tissue on top of bed next to tv remote pot on desk and chair. alot of banging in hall.

Worst Check In Experience Ever. Upon booking we has three key questions 1 Dog 2. Overheight Vehicle 68. secure parking at hotel 3. Bike Storage. they were only 1 for 3 dog only. I struggled to find somewhere to park as parking garage was only 62. and I was told it was 7 we ended up having to block the in ramp to the parking garage. First point of contact was at check in counter with a women who did not even look me in the eye no welcome or can we help you etc just a Credit card and ID. and I said I needed to ask about a few things first that quickly revealed the misstatements the reservation team made to me. No Bikes allowed or stored and no overheight parking at the hotel. After backed away to initiate looking for another hotel they did go to management to reluctantly deal with storing our bikes. Parking ended up 2blocks away unsecured in the convention center. We then had to unload every bag for a 2wek road trip as no secured parking and the bellman ignored us completely as we convoyed all our bikes bags and dog. No help offered. There were though some really good staff members that were helpful the second person I went to check in with after the first one definitely not meeting my expectations of customer service and also the bellman the next morning but our initial check in person and bellman on that afternoon shift were not trained to acceptable service levels for a 400 night stay. The hotel is in a very tough traffic location for load unload if you have gear. Rooms and rest of experience were good but that bad arrival experience and their pool logistics for traveling with a over height vehicle and gear would stop me from staying here again.

Guest services are very friendly but appear understaffed. Overall the only hang up I have with this property is the Front Desk kiosk Guest Services and their staffing or lack their of. I spent three days at this property for business and on various times the average wait time to talk to someone at the front desk all resulted in me waiting in a line for 10 20min. My advice is if you are in a hurry and think you ’l just pop by the front desk kiosk before you go out give yourself 20 min just in case. Side note the staff were great and super friendly. It is of no fault of theirs but I just think that the guest services department may be a bit understaffed. I seemed that way to me at least.

I am currently staying at this place but I am not liking it. If I have to connect with someone for room service they take almost 5 minutes to pick the phone and another 20 minutes to send someone for room service. I had problem with the WiFi and they suggested me to wait for a day so someone from their technical team can assist me.

Nice hotel beware the 30 Early Check in Fee. The Motif Seattle is centrally located in downtown Seattle. The staff is friendly and helpful if not outstanding. The Hotel does charge an urban amenity fee which they explain covers wifi and gym both included in most other hotels but also various unlimited coffee water in the room which is sometimes not included at other hotels. The check in time is 40pm. I arrived at 20pm and was told the room was in fact ready. however if I wanted early access to the room there is a 30 early check in fee in addition to the amenity fee they already charge. I stay in hotels all over the world for work and this is the first time I have encountered a fee to be able to go to the room when it is actually ready. Maybe the Motif management team will reconsider this unnecessary and avaricious policy.

Needs some improvements in service. My husband and I recently spent a night at this hotel. Overall the hotel is nice but the service needs some improvements. I am Globalist with Hyat and this location is now affiliated with Hyat. Upon checking in I asked about an upgrade and told there were none available. However when looking at the ap they had all the upgrade options available that is supposed to be guaranteed for Globalist. We had an appetizer at Frolik. the food was very good. They do add a 20 service charge to your bill which I did not catch the first time just a reminder to read your bills before you sign pay. We used the exercise room and half the TVs would not turn on and the garbage bin was beyond overflowing see picture. We had breakfast again at Frolik and the food was very good. This time I caught the 20 service charge. The room itself was fine pretty basic. Bed was comfortable. The shower did not have much water pressure. Overall a good stay but they need to up their service.

Clean neat fancy hotel. It does not look like a traditional hotel eg Crown Plaza. In the lobby they prepare wine and chocolate samples and demonstrate some food sample. In the rooms you can use alexa to call room service.
